sentence.text: We summarize recent updates on the genes and related clinical syndromes involved in the pathogenesis of early-onset epileptic encephalopathies: Aristaless-related homeobox (protein sumoylation), cyclin-dependent kinase-like 5 (regulation of postsynapse organization), syntaxin-binding protein 1 (protein localization to plasma membrane), solute carrier family 25 member 22 (L-glutamate transmembrane transport), nonerythrocytic α-spectrin-1 (MAPK cascade), phospholipase Cβ1 (PLCβ1), membrane-associated guanylate kinase inverted-2 (positive regulation of receptor internalization), polynucleotide kinase 3'-phosphatase (response to oxidative stress), sodium channel neuronal cardiac muscle tissue development 1α subunit (cardiac muscle cell action potential involved in contraction), protocadherin 19 (cell adhesion), and pyridoxamine 5-prime-phosphate oxidase (pyridoxal phosphate biosynthetic process)

entity.text: cardiac muscle cell action potential involved in contraction
